channel.title: Sports Radio NY
channel.description: A network of New York sports talk shows heard on Long Island's AM1240-WGBB every Sunday night at 9:00pm.
channel.itunes:author: Sports Radio NY
channel.itunes:summary: Something different in New York sports talk. Hear from sports figures not typically heard from on other stations.
channel.itunes:subtitle: A network of New York sports talk shows.

item.title: 12/04/2011 - SPORTSTALK1240 w Kevin Cunningham & Justin Zucker
item.description: Hosted by Kevin Cunningham and Justin Zucker. Topics on the show included both the Jets win and the Giants loss earlier in the day. Discussion about the Marlins signing of Jose Reyes kicked off the second half of the show, before getting back to the NFL talking with frequent caller Elwood from Indianapolis.

item.title: 12/04/2011 - SPORTSTALK1240 with Mike Carver
item.description: Hosted by Mike Carver. Topics on the show included the Jets win over the Redskins, the Giants to the loss Packers as well as some discussion about Peyton Manning and the Colts. The Marlins signing of Jose Reyes was also discussed, before closing out the show with some NHL talk with Tony Stabile from Hockey This Week and Kevin DeLury from the NY Rangers Blog.

item.title: 11/27/2011 - SPORTSTALK140 with Greg Locke
item.description: Hosted by Greg Locke. Guests included Anthony Donohue from The Knicks Blog, who spoke about the end of the NBA lockout, the CBA and of course the New York Knicks. In the second half of the program, Greg, co-host Joe Carcagno and Sports Radio NY writer Cody Normand spoke about the Jets, Tim Tebow and the rest of the NFL.

item.title: 11/27/2011 - The Starting NYNE with Paul Revelant
item.description: Hosted by Paul Revelant. Topics on the show included the Knicks and the end of the NBA lockout, with the NBA players owners reaching a tentative agreement. Then Paul and his co-hosts John Revelant and Vinny Chiarucci spoke mostly about the Jets, before closing the show talking about some of the other NFL teams and potential playoff races.

item.title: 11/20/2011 - NY Baseball Digest with Mike Silva
item.description: Hosted by Mike Silva. Mike gives his thoughts on the Yanks “wait and see” approach with the free agent starting pitching market, if Eduardo Nunez can be used as the centerpiece of a deal, and how the Yanks and Braves could come together on a deal. Also discussed was the Mets 50th anniversary press conference, trading David Wright, the new walls at CitiField and finally the new playoff system and collective bargaining agreement. Guests included Brien Jackson from It's About the Money and Steve Keane from the Kranepool Society.

item.description: Hosted by Eric Mirlis and Derek Wasiak. Topics discussed included the Jets season through 10 games, including their most recent loss in Denver. The guys also talked a little about the Islanders and their various events this season honoring past teams and players.

item.title: 11/06/2011 - SPORTSTALK1240 with Kevin, Joe and Justin
item.description: Hosted by Kevin Cunningham, Joe Balarezo and Justin Zucker. The guys discussed the Jets win over the Bills, and the Giants upset win against the Patriots as well as next weeks games fore both teams. A little hot stove was touched upon starting with the Yankees resigning C.C Sabathia and possible starters in their rotation next season, followed by Jose Reyes free agency and the new CitiField dimensions. Also discussed were the 0-8 Colts and the possibility they might be gunning for Stanford QB Andrew Luck.

item.title: 11/06/2011 - NY Baseball Digest with Mike Silva
item.description: Hosted by Mike Silva along with NYBD contributor Joe Delgrippo. The latest Yankees news and rumors were discussed during the first half of the show, including the re-signing CC Sabathia, what pitchers they should target this offseason, and if they should make a run at an offensive player. In the back-half of the program, Mets news and rumors were discussed including the new CitiField dimensions, Jose Reyes free agency, and whether the Mets should trade David Wright. Also discussed was the Hall of Fame Golden Era ballot released earlier this week.

item.title: 10/30/2011 - SPORTSTALK1240 with Adam Kern
item.description: A special edition of SPORTSTALK1240 hosted by Adam Kern, along with former New York Jet Victor Green. Guests on the show included Jessie "The Hammer" Tuggle, former linebacker for the Atlanta Falcons; Chris Doleman, 8-time Pro-Bowl linebacker for the Minnesota Vikings; and Matt Bryant, current kicker for the Atlanta Falcons. All NFL talk as the Jets (and Falcons) were on their bye week.

item.title: 10/23/2011 - NY Hockey Talk with Rob Kowal
item.description: Hosted by Rob Kowal and Brad Kurtzberg. Guests on the program included longtime Islanders broadcaster Jiggs McDonald, who spoke about the Islanders play to start the season. Next on the show was frequent guest Matt Sweetwood from the popular Devils fan website and message forum NJDEVS. Matt as always gave his pointed insights on the New Jersey Devils. Finally the guys closed out the show talking with the recently retired NHL referee turned NHL analyst Kerry Fraser. Kerry spoke about some of the more memorable incidents throughout his 30 year career, many of which are featured in his new book entitled The Final Call: Hockey Stories from a Legend in Stripes coming out in November.

item.title: 09/11/2011 - NY Baseball Digest with Mike Silva
item.description: Hosted by Mike Silva. On this 10th anniversary of 9/11, Mike took a look back with guests that included former Yankee pitcher Steve Karsay, who gave up Mike Piazza's memorable home run at Shea Stadium back on on September 21st, 2011 as a member of the Atlanta Braves; and former MLB pitcher C.J. Nitkowski, who was on the Mets back on 9/11. Special guest and long-time national anthem singer at Madison Square Garden John Amirante came on to close out the show.

item.description: Adam Kern hosts along with Anthony Ambrosino. Former New York Jets quarterback Glenn Foley was a featured guest on the program this week, talking football with Adam and Anthony for the full hour. Topics discussed during the show included Glenn's time playing with the Jets, his battle with depression after he retired, the size of players in the NFL, and how injuries are often downplayed in the league. Glenn also gave his thoughts on Mark Sanchez and the current Jets team, including their upcoming matchup with the Ravens on Monday night- and how he feels that Long Island football fans are the best in the world.

item.title: 07/18/2010 - NY Baseball Digest with Mike Silva
item.description: Hosted by Mike Silva. Kicking off the show was former big league catcher Brent Mayne who shares his experience as the American League bullpen catcher at the All Star Game. Then former big leaguer David Newhan joined Mike on the program. David’s father Ross is a Hall of Fame sportswriter, and David talks about growing up in a media family, the miraculous recovery from a potential career ending injury he suffered this year, and his time playing in New York. Finally Howard Megdal of SNY rounded out the show with his weekly segment, giving his thoughts on George Steinbrenner, a report on Wilpon MLS ownership, and what we can expect from the Mets the remainder of this West Coast trip.
